facts.text: Appellant selected by Public Service Commission as direct recruit on 20 May 1965.
Appellant appointed on 26 May 1965 and joined as probationer with two years probation period.
On 1 July 1967, period of probation extended by one year.
On 20 May 1968, order terminating services of appellant issued.
Appellant on leave from 20 May 1968 to 2 August 1968, period excluded from probation.
On 20 July 1968, order revoking termination and extending probation for six months from 20 May 1968.

Order of termination passed on 30 January 1969, effective 2 February 1969 A.N., dispensing with services under Rule 8(b) of Punjab Police Service Rules 1959, considering appellant unfit for appointment to State Police Service.
High Court judgment dated 5 November 1969 in Civil Writ No. 309 of 1969 dismissing appellant's writ.
Inspector General of Police's affidavit stated appellant's record during probation was unsatisfactory.

legal_issues.text: Whether the order of termination of the service of the appellant, a probationer, is in violation of Rule 9 of the Punjab Civil Services (Punishment and Appeal) Rules, 1952.

petitioner_arguments.text: Order of termination passed on 30 January 1969 after appellant stood confirmed on 19/20 November 1968 due to expiry of three years.
Order of termination is one of punishment as it states appellant considered unfit for appointment, and appellant's record was unsatisfactory, attracting Rule 9 requiring opportunity to show cause.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Rule 9 of Punjab Civil Services (Punishment and Appeal) Rules, 1952

respondent_arguments.text: Termination under Rule 8(b) of Punjab Police Service Rules 1959 is distinct from penalties under Rule 11 which refers to Punjab Civil Services (Punishment and Appeal) Rules; no violation of Rule 9.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Rule 8(b) and Rule 11 of Punjab Police Service Rules 1959; Rule 9 of Punjab Civil Services (Punishment and Appeal) Rules, 1952

court_reasoning.text: Period of probation had not expired by January 1969 due to extensions and exclusion of leave period; appellant could not be confirmed before probation end.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Object of extending probation is to assess fitness; no automatic confirmation.

court_reasoning.text: Termination order based on unfitness for appointment at confirmation time, not on misconduct or turpitude; words 'unfit' do not cast stigma or amount to punishment.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Termination for inadequacy or unsuitability without moral turpitude is not punishment; preserves authority to judge fitness.

court_reasoning.text: Rule 9 applies to termination for specific fault implying unsuitability with opportunity; here, simple termination under Rule 8(b) on unfitness, separate from penalties under Rule 11.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Facts do not show stigma attached to order.

holdings.text: Termination of probationer's services on ground of unfitness for appointment under Rule 8(b) does not attract Rule 9 of Punjab Civil Services (Punishment and Appeal) Rules, 1952, as it is not punitive.

statutes_cited.name: Punjab Police Service Rules, 1959
statutes_cited.relevance: Rule 8(b) allows dispensation of services of probationer reported unfit; Rule 11 governs discipline, penalties via Punjab Civil Services Rules, distinguishing termination from punishment.

statutes_cited.name: Punjab Civil Services (Punishment and Appeal) Rules, 1952
statutes_cited.relevance: Requires opportunity to show cause for termination on specific fault, unsatisfactory record or unfavourable reports implying unsuitability; held not applicable here.

outcome.summary: Appeal by special leave dismissed; termination order upheld as not violative of Rule 9, being simple termination on unfitness without stigma of punishment.
outcome.costs: Parties to pay and bear their own costs.

key_quotes.text: "The President of India is pleased to dispense with the service of Shri Hari Singh Mann... having considered him unfit for appointment to the State Police Service."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Text of termination order central to determining if punitive.

key_quotes.text: "To hold that the words unfit to be appointed are a Stigma would rob the authorities of the power to judge fitness for work or suitability to the post at the time of confirmation."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Core reasoning why termination not punishment.

key_quotes.text: "Termination of services on account of inadequacy for the job or for any temperamental or other defect not involving moral turpitude is not a stigma which can be called discharge by punishment."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Distinguishes simple termination from punitive action.
